Title: Cyclomatic Complexity - What it is, why you should care, and how to reduce it using the Strategy Pattern - The Long Walk
Description: Cyclomatic complexity is one of those terms that makes you think you missed something when you were learning programming. However, the concept is a really simple one. Cyclomatic complexity is simply the number of paths through your code. There are more detailed explanations if you scan the web (involving edges and nodes), but for this […]

Title: eric.com » PowerShell TDD: Testing CmdletBinding and OutputType
Description: A while ago, I decided to add PowerShell to my automation toolbox. Since I believe the best way to learn a new language is to do test-driven development and PowerShell has a fantastic module for this, called Pester. The framework is super intuitive, easy to do mocking in, and allows you develop your code design from tests.

Title: How to Relieve Backpressure In Message-Based Systems
Description: In the world of message-based systems, asynchronous messaging in a distributed system is great! However, async messaging has its downsides as well.

Title: Code in database vs. code in application
Description: In which we address the perennial question of when it’s appropriate to push domain logic into database stored procedures and triggers versus keeping it at the application layer.

Title: Functor relationships
Description: Sometimes you need to use more than one functor together.

Title: Thoughts on the potato diet
Description: Nine observations about what happens when you eat only potatoes

Title: An Overview of Kandria's Development with Lisp
Description: This is a short overview of the development that's gone into Kandria, the open world action RPG I've been working on in recent years.
